findings.title: Reentrancy vulnerability
findings.description: Reentrancy vulnerability allows an attacker to drain the contract's funds by repeatedly calling a function.

findings.title: Unchecked transferring of tokens
findings.description: The smart contract allows unchecked transferring of tokens which can lead to unauthorized token transfers.

findings.title: Proper importing of NPM packages
findings.description: The audit report highlights the usage of direct imports from other frameworks and smart contracts, including IERC20Extended, SafeMath, IUniswapV2Factory, and others. It is essential to ensure proper importing of these NPM packages to prevent potential security risks.

findings.title: Stating the visibility of state variables
findings.description: State variables are not explicitly declared as public or private.

findings.title: Unused Functions
findings.description: The contract has unused functions which can increase the attack surface and make it more vulnerable to potential attacks.
